bwg.wikidata¶

Module contents¶

This module provides two different way to access Wikidata:
  • Through the Wikimedia API with Pywikibot as a wrapper
  • Over a scraper using BeautifulSoup4

Currently, accessing the data via the API is faster than the scraper.

class bwg.wikidata.AbstractWikidataMixin¶

Bases: object

Define the functions inheriting subclasses should implement.

get_entity(wikidata_id, language, relevant_properties, properties_implying_relations)¶

Get Wikidata information about an entity based on its identifier.

Parameters:
  • wikidata_id (str) – Wikidata ID of desired entity.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
  • relevant_properties (list) – Types of claims that should be included.
  • properties_implying_relations – Set of property IDs for properties that are not mere characteristics, but

imply other relations that should later be shown in the graph. :type properties_implying_relations: list, set :return: List of dates about every sense of the entity (un-ambiguous entites just will have one sense). :rtype: list

get_matches(name, language)¶

Get matches for an entity’s name on Wikidata.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Name of entity.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
Returns:

List of matches.
Return type:

list
class bwg.wikidata.RequestCache¶

Bases: object

Special class used as a Cache, so that requests being made don’t have to be repeated if they occurred in the past.

request(key, request_func, *request_args, **request_kwargs)¶

Make a request, but make a lookup to the cache first to see if you may be able to avoid it.

Parameters:
  • key (str, int) – Key that should be used to cache the request.
  • request_func (func) – Function to do the request.
  • request_args (tuple) – Arguments for request.
  • request_kwargs (dict) – Key word arguments for request.
class bwg.wikidata.WikidataAPIMixin¶

Bases: bwg.wikidata.AbstractWikidataMixin

Access Wikidata information via Wikimedia’s API.

get_entity(wikidata_id, language, relevant_properties, properties_implying_relations, recursively=True)¶

Get Wikidata information about an entity based on its identifier.

Parameters:
  • wikidata_id (str) – Wikidata ID of desired entity.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
  • relevant_properties (list) – Types of claims that should be included.
  • properties_implying_relations – Dict of property IDs for properties that are not mere characteristics, but

imply other relations that should later be shown in the graph. The properties are the keys and the entity node class they’re implying are the values. :type properties_implying_relations: dict :param recursively: Request data for fof nodes recursively. :type recursively: bool :return: Wikidata entity as dictionary :rtype: dict

get_entity_name(entity_id, language)¶

Get the name of a wikidata entity.

Parameters:
  • entity_id (str) – Wikidata property ID.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
Returns:

Name of entity.
Return type:

str
static get_image_url(image_name)¶

Generate Wikidata URL for a Wikidata image.

Parameters:image_name (str) – Name of image as given by the API request.
Returns:Link to image.
Return type:str

  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
Returns:

List of matches.

Get the name of a wikidata property.

Parameters:
  • property_id (str) – Wikidata property ID.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
Returns:

Name of property.

match_cache = <bwg.wikidata.RequestCache object>¶
request_cache = <bwg.wikidata.RequestCache object>¶
resolve_claims(claims, language, relevant_properties, properties_implying_relations, recursively=True)¶

Resolve the claims (~ claimed facts) about a wikidata entity.

Parameters:
  • claims (dict) – Dictionary with property ID as key and claim data as value.
  • language (str) – Abbreviation of target language.
  • relevant_properties (list) – Types of claims that should be included.
  • properties_implying_relations – Set of property IDs for properties that are not mere characteristics, but

imply other relations that should later be shown in the graph. :type properties_implying_relations: list, set :param recursively: Request data for fof nodes recursively. :type recursively: bool :return: List of dates about every sense of the entity (un-ambiguous entities just will have one sense). :rtype: list

wikidata_site = DataSite("wikidata", "wikidata")¶

wikidata_base_url = 'https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/'¶
wikidata_entity_url = 'https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/{entity_id}'¶
wikidata_property_url = 'https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Property:{property_id}'¶
wikidata_search_url = 'https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?search=&search={name}&language={language}'¶
